page.title: 04THE NOWER
page.content: The{Nower}is a{sandstone hill}to the south west of Dorking. It is towards the eastern end of the{lower greensand {escarpment}which reaches its highest point at Leith Hill. Originally it was the garden for a house which stood on the site of Nower Lodge School. During the last war it was used by the Polish army for training and many of their trenches still remain. Today the Nower is part of the {greenbelt}and consists of a large area of grass and woodland. A one day survey showed that 50% of the people using the Nower did so to{exercise {their dogs,}99% of these came every day and lived within a few miles of the area. Others used the area for {jogging, walking}and a number of children used it as a short cut to school. In winter a great number of people use the slopes for{sledging.
